intro: Ruschia approximata, commonly known as the rock fig or dwarf rock fig, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its compact size and drought tolerance, it is well-suited for container gardening as well.
